page.title: 06CLOSURE OF ALKHAM SCHOOL
page.content: In May 197O a statutory notice of closure was served on Alkham Primary School. Dover MP David Ennals decided to fight for the school to remain open and meetings were held with parents and managers. A petition was drawn up which had 1OO% support from villagers, this stated that the school closure would destroy the village community and parents objected to their children travelling and having unnecessarily long hours away from home. On 28th July 1972 the school closed after 1O7 years and thirty local children travelled to a new school in Capel. Transport was initially provided free. Items of interest from the school were auctioned and the school buildings sold for Â£12,9OO. The buildings were converted into cottages for sale.
